result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick L Williams

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Aneeq Ahmad in court for Derrick L Williams. Defendant Derrick L Williams not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer Tate on behalf of Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense has received most of the discovery and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing. All motions to be filed within 45 days of today's date. Any evidentiary matters will be heard on the final pretrial date. Case adjourned, Branch 38.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 3, 2023 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 20, 2023 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Aneeq Ahmad in court for Derrick L Williams.  Derrick Williams not in court, in custody.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin. Court granted defense request for an adjourned status hearing in Branch 38.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Borowski.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.

Defendant Derrick L Williams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Aneeq Ahmad appeared by video for Derrick L Williams. Jennifer Jean Tate in court, appeared in person for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Detective S. Said.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Notice of Completion of Representation by Attorney Steve Sargent received and filed.  bm

Attorney Aneeq Ahmad in court, defendant Derrick L Williams not in court, in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was cancelled for today. Attorney Ahmad is newly retained and needs time to meet with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Retainer received and filed.  bm

Adjustment Number: 22A 073593,
Payable Number: 1023760,
Receipt Number: 22RP031080,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no contact with Brittany H., Passion R.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES: 
 Defendant Derrick L Williams in court with attorney Margo Elise Clark.  Defendant Derrick L Williams in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 12.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
